subject: Programming
title: The Northeast Blackout of 2003
description: A fast breakdown of The Northeast Blackout of 2003 for builders.

hook.text: On August 14, 2003, the lights went out for 55 million people across the northeastern US.

buildup.text: Power lines sagged into trees in Ohio, triggering a cascading overload across the grid.

discovery.text: The alarm system that should have warned operators had crashed due to a software race condition.

twist.text: Operators saw no alerts for over an hour while the grid spiraled into collapse.

climax.text: A silent software failure turned a local problem into the largest blackout in North American history.

punchline.text: A silent alarm plunged 55 million into darkness.

quiz.question: What software failure contributed to the 2003 Northeast blackout?
options: The alarm system crashed from a race condition
A virus attacked the power grid
